TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FingertipPlacementRelation extends Microsoft.Gestures.FingersRelation`1<valuetype Microsoft.Gestures.RelativePlacement>

Docs.summary: Represents a constraint describing the relative placement of fingers.

remarks.para: The constraint can be used to indicate the state of between fingertips of different fingers. For example, to specify a which will be triggered when the user's index fingertip is placed above the user's thumb fingertip, use the following the following syntax:
remarks.code: var indexAboveThumbPose = new HandPose("IndexAboveThumb", new FingertipPlacementRelation(Finger.Index, RelativePlacement.Above, Finger.Thumb));
remarks.para: A constraint imposes the relation between the fingers of and the fingers of . Note that the relation is not symmetric. This means that if the values of and were to be swapped, the meaning of the entire constraint would be flipped.
Note that instances are mutable until the containing object is registered with the gestures runtime, at which point it becomes frozen and cannot be modified any longer.
